com.example.cshare.utils

Class MediaFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.cshare.utils.MediaFiles

  • public class MediaFiles
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility public class that allows the management of multimedia files and images.

    Provides methods for retrieving images from the camera or from the gallery and then proposes a treatment of these images (in terms of rotation and compression). The class also contains methods needed to create and retrieve files to store these images.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Clara Gros, Babacar Toure
    See Also:
    RegisterActivity, ProfileFragment, AddActivity

    • Method Detail

      • captureImage

        public static android.net.Uri captureImage(android.app.Activity activity,
                                           androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Launches the camera application to capture an image, creates a file to store the picture and returns its URI (Unique Resource Identifier). Call the startActivityForResult method in the activity/fragment where the method is called.

        In case of a failed or interrupted I/O operation, throws a IOException

        The method parameters are used to inform the context in which the method is called and to call the startActivityForResult method. If the method is called inside an activity, then the fragment parameter will be null and vice versa.

        Parameters:
        activity - (Activity) null if the method is called within a fragment
        fragment - (Fragment) null if the method is called within an activity
        Returns:
        (Uri) Picture file uri
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getOutputMediaFileUri(Context, File), createImageFile(Context)

      • choosePictureFromGallery

        public static void choosePictureFromGallery(android.app.Activity activity,
                                            androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment)
        Creates an chooser Intent to retrieve an image (.png or .jpeg) from a gallery application, the Intent will store the fileUri in the data attribute and call for the startActivityForResult method of the view within the method is called.

        The method parameters are used to inform the context in which the method is called and to call the startActivityForResult method. If the method is called inside an activity, then the fragment parameter will be null and vice versa.

        Parameters:
        activity - (Activity) null if the method is called within a fragment
        fragment - (Fragment) null if the method is called within an activity

      • processPicture

                                          android.net.Uri uri)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the uri of the picture to process and then returns the processed picture

        In case of a failed or interrupted I/O operation, throws a IOException

        Parameters:
        context - (Context) Current context
        uri - (Uri) File uri to process
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        handleSamplingAndRotationBitmap(ContentResolver, Uri), saveBitmap(Context, Bitmap)

      • handleSamplingAndRotationBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap handleSamplingAndRotationBitmap(android.content.ContentResolver contentResolver,
                                                                      android.net.Uri selectedImage)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method is responsible for solving the rotation issue if exist. Also scale the images to 200 x 200 resolution
        Parameters:
        contentResolver - The current context.getContentResolver()
        selectedImage - The Image URI
        Returns:
        Bitmap image results
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • calculateInSampleSize

        private static int calculateInSampleSize(android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options options,
                                         int reqWidth,
                                         int reqHeight)
        Calculate an inSampleSize for use in a BitmapFactory.Options object when decoding bitmaps using the decode* methods from BitmapFactory. This implementation calculates the closest inSampleSize that will result in the final decoded bitmap having a width and height equal to or larger than the requested width and height. This implementation does not ensure a power of 2 is returned for inSampleSize which can be faster when decoding but results in a larger bitmap which isn't as useful for caching purposes.
        Parameters:
        options - An options object with out* params already populated (run through a decode* method with inJustDecodeBounds==true
        reqWidth - The requested width of the resulting bitmap
        reqHeight - The requested height of the resulting bitmap
        Returns:
        The value to be used for inSampleSize

      • rotateImageIfRequired

        private static android.graphics.Bitmap rotateImageIfRequired(android.content.ContentResolver contentResolver,
                                                             android.graphics.Bitmap img,
                                                             android.net.Uri selectedImage)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Rotate an image if required.
        Parameters:
        img - The image bitmap
        selectedImage - Image URI
        Returns:
        The resulted Bitmap after manipulation
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                                                   int degree)
        Rotates an image from the angle passed in parameter and returns the rotated image
        Parameters:

        degree - (int) Rotation angle
        Returns:
        (Bitmap) The rotated bitmap

      • getOutputMediaFileUri

        public static android.net.Uri getOutputMediaFileUri(android.content.Context context,
                                                    java.io.File file)
        To securely offer a file from this app to another app, you need to configure your app to offer a secure handle to the file, in the form of a content URI. The Android FileProvider component generates content URIs for files, based on specifications you provide in XML.
        Parameters:
        context -
        file -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        FileProvider
